page.title: 07The Guidford Show
page.content: The Guildford Show has been held each year for the past 25 years. It takes a month to prepare and between 25,000 and 40,000 people come, depending upon the weather, from all over the country. Much of the Show is concerned with{agriculture. The Show, held at the back of Stoke Park, always begins with a parade of floats, led by the{Carnival {Queen}and accompanied by brass and marching bands. A new Carnival Queen is chosen each year to preside over the occasion. She also opens other local fetes during her year of office. Over the years the{safety}record of the Show has been excellent, with only minor injuries and one tent fire. The Show is held to raise money for local charities, Â£3,000 being the most raised so far.
